sentence.Network_en: I don't like all these newfangled gadgets.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些新潮玩意儿我不都喜欢.

sentence.Network_en: We need better teachers, not newfangled ideas about education!
sentence.Network_cn: 我们需要更好的老师, 而不是新奇的教育想法!

sentence.Network_en: Those newfangled inventions are no better than my old machines.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些新奇发明品不及我的旧机器.

PerfectNetExp.abs: new的反义词_百度知道 ... n...recent adj. 近来的,新近的 a...newfangled adj. 新奇的,最新式的 n...modern adj. 现代的,时髦的.
高口阅读词汇 - 豆丁网 ... unification 统一,联合,一致 newfangled 新奇的,新制的 craze 时尚;时髦的东西.

list.abs: a research team used a newfangled method for measuring rare isotopes to accurately date glaciers in New Zealand .一个研究小组使用一种新奇的方法来测量稀有同位素的含量，从而准确地的推测出位于新西兰的冰川年代。
the parade was a mix of old-fashioned communist-realist kitsch newfangled weaponry .阅兵式是古老的共产主义式的拙劣玩意儿，外加新式武器。
I don ' t like all these newfangled gadgets ., 这些新潮玩意儿我不都喜欢.

but what if they prompt a broader market meltdown ? after all , many of the newfangled instruments that dominate today's debt markets have never been tested in a serious panic .但这种情况如果引发了范围更广的市场破坏，又该如何呢？毕竟，支配当前债务市场的许多全新工具从未在严峻的恐慌局势中得到检验。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from newfangle (now dialect) 'liking what is new', from the adverb new + a second element related to an Old English word meaning 'to take'

entry.tran: (新想法或新设备)太复杂的，不必要的，时髦复杂的
entry.def: If someone describes a new idea or a new piece of equipment as new-fangled, they mean that it is too complicated or is unnecessary.

example.ex: Mr Goss does not believe in any of this 'new-fangled nonsense' about lean meat.
example.tran: 戈斯先生一点儿都不相信有关瘦肉的这种“奇谈怪论”。

means.word_mean: 1. of a new (often outrageous) kind or fashion
